meanings.definition: A person who is a fan or performer of punk rock music.
meanings.sent1: The punker wore a leather jacket covered in band patches.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of punkers at the concert last night.
meanings.sent3: The punker's Mohawk hairstyle was so tall, it almost touched the ceiling!
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit made her stand out like a punker in a sea of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The punker's energy on stage was electrifying, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: To engage in punk rock music or culture.
meanings.sent1: She loves to punker out by listening to loud music and wearing edgy clothes.
meanings.sent2: Let's punker together by going to that underground music show.
meanings.sent3: They decided to punker up their look by adding safety pins to their clothes.
meanings.sent4: His rebellious nature led him to punker against the mainstream music scene.
meanings.sent5: The band will punker up the crowd with their high-energy performance.

meanings.definition: A style or attitude associated with punk rock music.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit had a punker vibe with ripped jeans and studded accessories.
meanings.sent2: The punker of the group always had a carefree and bold attitude.
meanings.sent3: The cat's punker attitude was evident as it knocked things off the table for fun.
meanings.sent4: His rebellious spirit shone through his punker style, challenging societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's work reflected the raw energy of the punker culture.
